channel.title: Land of the free and the home of the brave
channel.description:
Oh United States of America you never surprise me, for the 18 years i've been here its still shit.
http://hypervocal.com/news/2011/youtube-musician-evan-emory-faces-20-years-in-prison-for-clever-editing/

item.title: Land of the free and the home of the brave
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:12, topic:382889”]In my opinion, prison sentences should only be used to protect society. That is to say that violent offenders, or offenders that exploit people (so drug dealers and so on) should face prison.
White collar crimes and ‘criminal offences’ like the one in this story should not face prison.
I can see where the parents are coming from, but 20 years in prison is absurd.
Community service may be appropriate, but only if it is deemed a criminal offence in the first place.[/quote]Community service is the best. Make them productive!

Read full topic
item.source: Land of the free and the home of the brave

item.title: Land of the free and the home of the brave
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

In my opinion, prison sentences should only be used to protect society. That is to say that violent offenders, or offenders that exploit people (so drug dealers and so on) should face prison.
White collar crimes and ‘criminal offences’ like the one in this story should not face prison.
I can see where the parents are coming from, but 20 years in prison is absurd.
Community service may be appropriate, but only if it is deemed a criminal offence in the first place.

Read full topic
item.source: Land of the free and the home of the brave

item.title: Land of the free and the home of the brave
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Parents are too outraged to worry whether Emory’s rights may be being infringed upon. One parent interviewed said, “He humiliated my child. He’s humiliated all the parents that are involved in it and something definitely needs to be done.”

That’s probably the whole reason this got blown up. If any one of those parents actually thought about it and considered he was their child they might realise they’re being idiots. The fact they don’t care about sending a guy to jail for 20 years when he did literally nothing to harm their children shows how shallow people really are.

Read full topic
item.source: Land of the free and the home of the brave

item.title: Land of the free and the home of the brave
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:7, topic:382889”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=478675.msg3504314#msg3504314 date=1298018659]

Yeah, taking the law too far. Before you know it child pornography laws in America will encompass cartoon characters like they do in Australia.
[/quote]That recently happened in Sweden, and i raged.

It’s ridiculous. Ideas such as animal rights are absurd, but at least animals are real creatures that can feel and suffer.
Bestowing protections upon non-existent ‘beings’ is the pinnacle of human stupidity.[/quote]Disagreed @ animal rights (i still hate retards like PETA), but yeah. It’s just a malformed form of political correctness made up by idiots.

Read full topic

[quote=“Speljohan, post:6, topic:382889”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=478675.msg3504292#msg3504292 date=1298014592]
Yeah, taking the law too far. Before you know it child pornography laws in America will encompass cartoon characters like they do in Australia.
[/quote]That recently happened in Sweden, and i raged.[/quote]
It’s ridiculous. Ideas such as animal rights are absurd, but at least animals are real creatures that can feel and suffer.
Bestowing protections upon non-existent ‘beings’ is the pinnacle of human stupidity.
